test_questions.question: In the series 2, 6, 18, 54, ...... what will be the 8th term ?
test_questions.explanation: Clearly, 2 x 3 = 6, 6 x 3 = 18, 18 x 3 = 54,.....So, the series is a G.P. in which a = 2, r = 3.Therefore 8th term = ar8-1 = ar7 = 2 x 37 = (2 x 2187) = 4374.
The pattern is - 45, - 35, - 25, .....So, missing term = 20 - 15 = 5.

The pattern is x 2 + 1, x 2 - 1, x 2 + 1, x 2 - 1,.....So, missing term = 101 x 2 + 1 = 203.
The sum of any three consecutive terms of the series gives the next term.So, missing number = 8 + 15 + 27 = 50.

test_questions.question: Which term of the series 5, 10, 20, 40, ..... is 1280?
test_questions.explanation: Clearly, 5 x 2 = 10, 10 x 2 = 20, 20 x 2 = 40,.....So, the series is a G.P. in which a = 5 and r = 2.Let 1280 be the rath term of the series.Then, 5x2n-1 = 1280  2n-1 = 256 = 28  n - 1 = 8  n = 9.

test_questions.question: In the series 3, 9, 15, ...... what will be the 21st term?
test_questions.explanation: Clearly, 3 + 6 = 9, 9 + 6 = 15,.....So, the series is an A.P. in which a = 3 and d = 6.Therefore 21st term = a + (21 - 1) d = a + 20d = 3 + 20 x 6 = 123.
